alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 5:08AM EDT until March 28 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Flint River near Thomaston affecting Talbot and Upson Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Crawford, Upson, Talbot and Taylor Counties. Flint River below Big Branch near Molena affecting Pike and Meriwether Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senioa, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands... fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet an slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 4.8 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
